author: ikanoi
body:
>Websites of several airlines, banks and technology companies, including Amazon's AWS, Delta Air Lines (DAL) and American Express (AXP), were facing outages, according to DownDetector. So far, I’ve been unable to find the cause.

Akamai DNS outage from what I heard through the grapevine at work. Over 24k sites affected.

body: **Akamai CDN (content delivery network) has gone down, which is why loads of the sites are struggling to load, offline altogether or glitching. Similar to the Fastly outage last month.**

author: liqui_date_me
body: Some things will definitely NOT change. The internet in its current form is here to stay, which means all the infrastructure companies that power the internet are here to stay. This means companies like Amazon (AWS), Microsoft (Azure), Oracle and Google (GCP) will stay around. Cisco will be around for networking and server hardware, as will CDN providers like Akamai.

author: tuxone
body: Another one. In the next months billions of iOS devices will get Apple Private Relay (ok actually only those with a paying iCloud subscription). This service will rely on CDN such as Cloudflare, Fastly and Akamai. And Cloudflare is the one with a focus on privacy that perfectly aligns with Apple vision. And both AAPL and NET have already collaborated on this privacy focused solutions. This is pure daydreaming, no advice. 209 @ $21
